author: Abhinav Rattan
content: Bitcoin reached a new all-time high price of $69,255 on CoinGecko today before quickly dropping back down to $66,700. The top cryptocurrency's previous all-time high of $67,617 was notched in November 2021. Bitcoin made new highs on some exchanges like Coinbase on Tuesday before immediately plunging 14%, causing $1 billion in liquidations across the crypto market.
title: Bitcoin hits new all-time high before dropping again

author: Ria Kapoor
content: Instagram influencer Chandni Bhabhda spoke to News9live on Women's Day. In an empowering message to young females, she said, "Make your flaws your biggest strength." "Don't be afraid to explore different avenues and experiment with various types of content until you find what truly resonates with you. Remember that authenticity is key," she further said.
title: Make your flaws your strength: Chandni's message on Women's Day

author: Ria Kapoor
content: A temple in Madhya Pradesh's Guna was decorated in wedding style on the occasion of Mahashivratri. Pictures of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati were also displayed in pre-wedding shoot style at the entrance of the. A board with Shiva and Parvati written on it was also put up as part of the decorations for Mahashivratri on March 8.
title: MP temple displays Shiva-Parvati photos in pre-wedding shoot style

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A Google software engineer in Bengaluru shared glimpses of her work life in an Instagram reel. After checking her schedule, she went for breakfast. Apart from coding and attending meetings, she goes for workouts, plays games, reads, and enjoys jamming sessions. "Head to office and entry with card tak to mere office me bhi same hai," a user joked.
title: Food, gym, games: Google employee shares glimpses of office life

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A rich housewife named Linda Andrade slammed her millionaire husband for not gifting her a mansion after giving birth. He bought her a handbag, a new car and a diamond from the luxury jewellery brand Cartier. "I'm a little annoyed though, because I asked for a mansion and he got me a condo," she said.
title: Millionaire's wife upset for not getting house after giving birth

author: Saumya Agrawal
content: A Reddit user shared insights from his experience on a week-long 2,000-person nude cruise. "This cruise is very non-sexual," he said. After spending the day nude in the sun, some people might dress up in the night. He added, "If you're there for the views, you're probably going for the wrong reasons."
title: Man who went on 2,000-person nude cruise shares what it is like

author: Abhinav Rattan
content: Bitcoin's price has settled following a severe dip earlier in the week. Analysts say the calm is allowing the market to play catch-up. Still, more volatility is coming, they warn. Rather than causing market-wide panic, analysts and experts say the move was necessary for Bitcoin's long-term outlook as exchange-traded funds continue to prop up demand.
title: Bitcoin price may be settling, but more volatility is on the way

author: Rashmi
content: Ananya Paul Dodmani's NGO TribalConnect has provided education to 21,000 women and children and sustainable livelihood opportunities to over 50,000 forest dwellers in Assam, Goa, Karnataka and Odisha. Her work has been instrumental in weaning forest people off kidnapping for extortion, especially in the NorthEast.
title: This Assam activist empowers tribals with education, livelihood

author: Ishita Gupta
content: Renowned poet Sahir Ludhianvi's life is a saga of resilience and artistry. He faced many societal challenges yet his poetry resonated with universal themes of love, humanity, and social justice. From struggling student to revered lyricist, Sahir's journey embodies the transformative power of words. His legacy lives on, immortalized in timeless verses that continue to inspire generations.
title: “mein pal do pal ka shayar hun”- Sahir Ludhianvi

author: Ishita Gupta
content: International Women's Day is a tribute to global strides towards gender equality. Originating from the fight for suffrage, the day was recognised by UN in 1977 to acknowledge the struggles of inequality women face in their daily life, despite progress.  UN initiatives drive empowerment and reminds us to continue the journey towards a world of genuine gender parity.
title: Celebrating International Women's Day on March 8
